content: the bor the ribbed hem using mc round 1 rs sm k1 p1 repeat - to end of round work 3/3/3/5/5 more rounds in rib-pattern as est in round 1 end at marker bor the stripe-pattern work the first 4 rounds as follows round 1 using mc sm k all sts to end of round rounds 2 - 4 using cc sm k all sts to end of round thereafter you work the following pattern-repeat of 5 rounds there is no need to twist the yarns on ws when switching colour to avoid the jog you follow the instructions on rounds 2 and 4 round 1 using mc sm k all sts to end of round round 2 using mc sm using the tip of your rhn pick up the strand of mc in front of the following st lifting it from back to front and placing it in front of the first st on your lhn knit the strand together with the first st to the left k all sts to end of round round 3 using cc sm k all sts to end of round round 4 using cc sm using the tip of your rhn pick up the strand of cc in front of the following st lifting it from back to front and placing it in front of the first st on your lhn knit the strand together with the first st to the left k all sts to end of round round 5 using cc sm k all sts to end of round repeat above rounds 1 5 until the lower body measures approximately 13/16/21/25/28 cm = 5/6 25/8 25/10/11 25 measured from the cast-on edge it s preferable to end after pattern round 5 of the stripe-pattern before dividing work break cc and continue work using mc only divide work for upper back and front using mc sm k all sts to end of round place the last 63/73/83/93/103 sts in the round on holders or on waste-yarn if using waste-yarn make sure to secure it properly to avoid dropping sts remove marker follow instructions for the upper back on page 5 4 the upper back work the first 63/73/83/93/103 sts back and forth for upper back in guernsey pattern the chart is worked from right to left on rs row from left to right on ws row follow the chart from row 1 10 and repeating on each rs row work the first 2 sts in the row following the chart thereafter work the pattern-repeat of 10 sts 6/7/8/9/10 times end with the last st of the chart on each ws row work the first st in the row following the chart thereafter work the pattern-repeat of 10 sts 6/7/8/9/10 times end with the last 2 sts of the chart continue work as instructed above until work measures 9/10/11/13/14 cm = 3 5/4/4 25/5/5 5 measured from the underarm where you split for front and back and ending on a ws row please
